transcript.content: Strokes, on XFM, 104.9. Ricky Gervais Show.
With Steve Merchant.
Definitely, definitely.
Ahoy!
And little Karl Pilkington.  Over there.
Little KP, the K-man.
Steve,
Yes.
Don’t worry anymore.
Uh, Ok.
I’ve procured some great gifts to give away.  I was tired,
Really?
Of seeing all these other people gettin’ gifts and that,
Yup.
And who was goin’ to that, uh, O’Dodell, and um, O’Diddley,
Diddley O’Diddley, yeah.
And uh, uh, Anderson and Sturgess – well she’s, at least she steals ‘em herself.
Well at least she, she steals ‘em herself to sell ‘em, to feed the habit, and that’s
Yeah!
Fine, I don’t mind that!
No!
‘Cause it’s industrious.
Exactly.  But I have got, Feeder, Echo Park, I’ve got The Essential Bob Dylan, now that is a good giveaway,
That’s a great giveaway.
And, Reloaded 3.
Where’ve you, did – did you buy these yourself?
No, little Karl found ‘em.
Let me, I have to say, Karl, you’ve done an absolute dynamite job here, mate.  This is great prizes!
And I thought we could play that trivia quiz, where we, we’re the challenge.
Right.
They, if they get someone to catch us out, maybe, or summat, the questions, like there,
You’ve confused me slightly, explain again?
Well we could play a little trivia quiz, couldn’t we.
Right.
And, then, we could, sell the fish.
Steve Laughs
To cut out the middle –
Use the words that you need –
Man,
To complete the sentence, Rick.
And, then, we could do the – play – this –
W-what’s the quiz?
I don’t know.
You’ve not thought this through!
No!
Coldplay - Yellow
Coldplay, and Yellow.
You’ve got to keep talkin’, Rick, we’re on the radio!
Have I?  I got bored.
Did you?
Yeah, with Steve Merchant.
What I was sayin’ was,
Yes.

We could have a little trivia quiz, right.  This is how it works: they’re phone in, yeah, right, and they’re pitch a question to us two, right.  We won’t know it, they’ll tell Karl, and Karl write down the answer, yeah, or, on his email, right, and then it might be summat like um, Ooh, uh, who was the, uh, first woman MP?  And, he’ll write down the answer, and he’ll go, Ok, Steve, Ricky, who’s the first woman MP?  We’ll write it down, you know, and you’ll write down summat like the Queen,
Yup.
And I’ll write down, Britney Spears,
Yeah.
And he’ll go, Well Ricky says Britney Spears, and the answer is – dada, you see?
Yes.  Yesyesyesyes.
And then, whoever’s –
So, do they phone in or do they, can they email as well?
They can email as well, Steve!
Right.  Ok.  So let me just try and clarify this, ‘cause I didn’t really follow that, and I know what the competition is.
Right!
Um, people listening, phone in or email in with a question, a trivia question, it could be about anything.  Right?
I don’t do game shows.

But, but one which we may be able to get, right.  They phone in with that, or they email it it, but only Karl knows the answer, he asks us here in the qu, the studio, the question, Ricky and I write it down independently, we hand it to Karl, we’ll see who’s got the right answer.
It’s like 15 to 1, but 2 to, 1.
And the great thing is, that the best question, that we’ll vote on at the very end of the show, can win these 3 CDs.  We’ve got Feeder, Echo Park, The Essential Bob Dylan – that’s a 2 CD set, Rick.
Maybe keep the questions highbrow, to show our intellect.  Not things like pop and trivia and telly and
Good idea.  And we’ve also got this big compilation Reloaded 3, that’s also a 2 CD compilation.
Well start phoning and emailing now!
Phoning, emailing your trivia
Go mental.  Go bezerk.  Absolutely go bezerk.
Questions, For Gervais, and Merchant.
I’m best at science.
Well don’t start giving things,
Well don’t say that!
That’s not fair ‘cause I’ll say I’m best at films!  If they want me to win.
Yeah, but I’ve already said don’t do trivia and entertainment and that.
Well they should do,
Don’t!  No!
They should do trivia and entertainment, music and films is what they should do.
No, the shouldn’t.
Or old TV.
That’s stupid, that’s the cliché of Xfm listeners, and I know they’re more intelligent than that.
They’re not.  They’re not, Rick.
Ricky Laughs
They’re stupid people!  They’re stupid, stupid people!  And they only know about a few things!
Garbage – Cherry Lips
Garbage, Cherry Lips, on Xfm 104.9.  Well, either they really want those CDs, or they want to embarrass us.
Mm.
‘Cause the phone lines are going mad.  And Karl is taking,
They are going mad, and we didn’t even give out the phone number or the email, Rick!  Shall I just give it out now?
Well, obviously don’t need to!
Well, I ought to anyway, for those that didn’t hear, didn’t know it already.
‘Of it.
08700, 08700 800 1234.  Sorry, that’s not 08700, 08700, ‘cause I, ‘cause I started again ‘cause I got, I sort of fluffed slightly.
Yeah, go on.
And when he says he fluffed slightly, that - that’s not how he got into television.
Exactly.  [email protected] if you want to email the question, and only Karl can see the screen, so there’s no, cheating.
Probably people don’t know what fluffing is, do they.
No, I don’t think so, Rick.  Uh, Karl, have you had a question?
What, already, are we doing it now?
Go on,
I – I think we should just drip ‘em in, throughout the course of the show –
Yeah, yeah, you drippin’ ‘em in.
Steve Laughs
Go on.  Ask us a question.
All right.  I thought this was good one.  It’s from Clive.
Go on then.
Clive!  We’ve got a listener called Clive!  Wow!
That’s all right.
Who, was the first James Bond.
Right.
Aw, it’s a film one!  He’ll know that!
No, but wait a minute, wait a minute,
No, I know this ambiguity – ‘cause we’ve talked about it,
We’ve talked about this ambiguity before, you see.  He could be – he might be deliberately embarrassing us, because the old myth is that someone played it on radio, that we all know and love.
Yeah.
Now, he should’ve specified, did he mean the film James Bond?  The first film James Bond?
Well I think the thing is, can I just say, we, we won’t count this one, ‘cause the definitive one, I talked to Glyn about this as well, it, it, it’s Dr. No, it’s the first one of the team that we
Sean Connery.  So, Sean Connery is the first screen James Bond,
So, we, we agree on that, even if we’re both wrong.  What does he say it is.  I’ll bet he said, I’ll bet he said, it was Bob Holness, who played him on radio, in like the 1950s.
He didn’t say the radio bit, but he said Bob Holness.
Hm.  From Blockbusters!
Yeah.
And I was drawing, a little Blockbuster thing!
That’s really spooky.
That is, that’s weird, innit.
But the thing about that is, I – I’m worried if it might be a myth.  It may be a myth.
Well, no, I don’t think it is, it’s that we can’t have that –
One point to me then!
Noo.
Yes.
No, definitely not.
Well you didn’t know it – did you know it.  Did you honest-
Yeah, we talked about it!
No, rubbish!  Yeah, but who – well if we talked about it, did I say it to you.
No, we agreed that it was Sean Connery, because, just like we didn’t count Casino Royale ‘cause you said it wasn’t by the same team and
Yeah, but that wouldn’t have been the first James Bond anyway, ‘cause that came later in the series!  No, Rick!  Nonononono –
There’s no way.  There’s no way.
No, don’t play the music,
No way.
That’s clearly a point!  You didn’t know it was Bob Holness.  He meant it was Bob Holness, I knew the answer!  One-nill.
Fun Lovin’ Criminals – Scooby Snacks
Well, Fun Lovin’ Criminals, Scooby Snacks.  Anyway, it doesn’t matter.  ‘Cause we, we both agreed once in a pub that the right answer is Sean Connery!
Yeah, but wait a minute, wait a minute, Rick,
And we both knew that.
The point’s not that.  The man phoned in with a question, and the answer the man was after, was Bob Holness.
Oh!  Ok!
And that’s the answer I gave!
I’ll tell you what, the answer I was after, was me.
But that’s nonsense, Rick!  He’s the question master!  The man who phoned in!  That’s ludicrous!  You, you, face the facts!
You can’t say, you can’t say, what number am I thinking of,
That’s – What are you talkin’ about?!
It’s got to be the real answer,
No, but I knew the answer he was after!
So brilliant!
Yes!  Because that’s, you know, even if he’s, got it wrong, it’s such common parlance now, that, Bob Holness was the first James Bond, that I knew the answer!  Face the facts!
Right.  Give us another question, Karl.
Jeez!
Give us another question.
Gaw, he’s a bad loser, isn’t he?
Ricky Laughs
I had a good one here, but,
You’ve forgotten it?
Or,
I sort of scribbled it down.  Um,
This is brilliant, innit.
‘ang on a minute,
We can edit this out, can’t we?  It’s not live, is this?
It’s only a pilot.
Ricky and Steve laugh
This is gonna look great when it, when it comes out.  Go on.
Which food,
Yeah.
Um,
Karl, you now making up the question.
No-no, it’s just that I sort of took down the important bits –
Br—this is amazing.  This is amazing radio.  Go on!
Which food, kind of doesn’t make you fat.
Jesus.
Steve Laughs
What?!  Kind of question is that?!
Aw, this is rid-
No, it is proper.
I love, I love, imagine this, on The Weakest Link.
Steve Laughs
What kind of food, doesn’t sort of make you, I mean, it doesn’t make you fat ..
Um,
This is ludicrous!
Ok, do you want me to –
Basically, no, sort of calories in it.
Um, celery.
Water.
Well, I mean, what do you mean.  Do you mean a – a – a vegetable, do you mean –
No, you’re right, you’re right.  Apparently, ya use more eating it –
Yeah, you use more calories to bite it than to –
Yeah, but wait a minute, wait a minute, Rick,
1 – 1 all.
No, it’s not one all,
Of course it is!
Because you’re supposed to write it down!
You didn’t know!
But you didn’t – I – what do you mean I didn’t know?!  You’re supposed to write it down, that’s the whole point, we’re writing things down!
YOU SAID WATER!  YOU SAID WATER!
BUT THAT’S BECAUSE I THOUGHT WE WEREN’T TAKIN’ THE QUESTION SERIOUSLY, ‘CAUSE HE DIDN’T KNOW WHAT HE’S TALKIN’ ABOUT!
1 all!
We’ve got to set the rules, this is ludicrous!
Beta Band - Squares
Bit too much like Portishead, for my liking.
Was it?
Yeah.
I quite enjoyed it.
Beta Band.  Well, that’s ‘cause Portishead are from your neck of the woods, innit.  Is it?
Steve Laughs
No, fair criticism, Rick.
Well, Portishead – yeah, yeah.
I’ve embarrassed myself!
Ricky and Steve laugh
Right – w- another question, quick.  Is this, is this one, is this question, a real question with a definitive answer, or is it like What is my most comfortable chair?
Steve Laughs
I don’t know why people aren’t going to like, maybe Trivial Pursuit or some’ing, just getting a question off that, and then –
‘Cause they’re, they’re a little bit more discernin’ than that, Steve!
Rick, have you heard the questions?!  They don’t know what they’re talkin’ about!
Ricky Laughs
This is stuff they’ve overheard in pubs!
Go on!  Ask it – ask it, Karl.  I love (mumbles) Karl takes it down and goes, What’s that?
Steve Laughs
I know!
What am I meant to write?  Go on then, ask this one.
Right.  Um, whi- what sort, no.
Ricky and Steve laugh
The pope,
Yeah.
Um, what semi-
Sorry Anne – Mrs. Robinson, we’re gonna have to let you go.
Yeah!
Go on.
You are the weakest link, Karl.   Goodbye.
Ricky Laughs
Yeah, go on.
The pope,
Yeah.  The pope, yeah, we’ve got The Pope, yeah, that’s not strictly a question.
He wears a, uh,
Oh Christ.  He wears a dustman’s hat, he wears gorblimy trousers.
Steve Laughs
Yeah.
Does he live in a council flat?
Yeah, he lives in a council flat,
He wears a semi-precious stone.  What’s the stone.
The pope wears a semi-precious stone, what is the stone.
You mean, you mean, what is it called?
Yeah.
What is it called.
What, has it got like a kind of um, papal name.
Well I think, I think it’s like, you know, is it – an 18 carat one.
Is it –
Steve Laughs
So we’ve got to try and get the carat,
Right.
Ricky Laughs
Yeah.
Of the pope’s big diamond.
He calls it Dennis, he calls it Dennis the Stone.
Steve Laughs
Do they want the, do they want the type of gem it is, diamond, jade,
Or is there some kind of papal name for it?
Ruby, or, do they want it like the Rosetta Stone.
I don’t know.
Or, the – oh.
Steve Laughs
I can’t - play a record.  Play two records.
Steve laughs
Basement Jaxx – Where’s Your Head At
Where’s Your Head At, Basement Jaxx.
Mm.
Right, Ok, Let’s get this right.
Have we, have we knocked this on the head, then.  Is this not happening.
Oh here he is.  Look.
Here he is.
Come in!
Steve Laughs
Hey look, he’s –
How’ve you –
Owh!
God!
I don’t believe that!
Oh, that’s pathetic!
I do not believe that.
That’s absolutely pathetic.
Now they won’t believe this, will they.
No.
Right.  If I say that Jonathan Ross just got his massive member out, and he is a big lad,
Yeah.
Come in – come and sit down.
I’ve got your tickets, Mr Gervais.
Thank you.
Wh – what’s goin’ on there, then?  I mean, why are you dropping off tickets,
Well because, you know, in the spirit of the comedy awards, we like to have the rising young stars, of the British Comedy Awards.
That’s right.
Yeah.
And that’s me.
Well, we couldn’t find any this year,
Ricky and Steve laugh
So we asked Ricky whether he would sit in the Rising Young Stars seat, and I – I wanted to deliver the tickets personally, so there’s no excuses if he doesn’t turn up later.
Yeah.
I- I always suspected that you were, sort of, pretty well endowed.
Yeah.
And then, now, and now we’ve seen.  Y’know it’s on webcam, that.  That is.
That was just one of my cocks!
Ricky and Steve laugh
We got in trouble sayin’ that, didn’t we?
That’s the one you’re wearin’ today.  Yeah, don’t say that, no we were in trouble–
This is meant to be the happenin’ young station!  What’s going on?
No, you can’t say stuff like that.  You can’t.
Just – just careful what you say, look what happened to Julian Clary, ten years in the wilderness and then he comes back in the personal ads.  That can happen to you!
Ten years in the wilderness?
Can I just ask,
That’s Jesus you’re thinkin’ of!
Let’s just, just ‘cause you’re on everything at the moment,
I walked in here, and I came in here, and I thought this is the young happenin’ place, and what do I see in here?  Three old men sittin’ --
What are you talkin’ about?!  I’m only 28!  27.
Yeah.  You’re wrecked!  You all looked wrecked!
That’s ‘cause we’re always partyin’!
I was lookin’ for some youngsters!  Where’s the youngsters?  I wanted to see some tight leather pants!
Steve Laughs
I wanted to see some foxy chicks,
Look how –
Hangin’ on your every word!  What is it, it’s a bunch of old blokes and a bloke over there washin’ up, in a sink.
Steve Laughs
But look at him - he even dresses for radio!  Look at him!
This is ludicrous.
It’s amazing!  The – looks like – you’re one step away –
I love the fact, you were on the phone to Gervais last night, weren’t you, asking his advice,
Yeah.
On clothes!  Look at him!
Well I’ll –
He’s goin’ for the man down the DSS look!
I like that look – no, it’s a nice look!
Innit!  Thank you.
Have you got a single pair of trousers that aren’t elasticated at the waist.
Ricky and Steve laugh
They’re ma- they’re maternity jeans, aren’t they?  They’ve got the whole front panel for –
The thing is, what I do is, at the end of the, week, I can pop these in a pan and I can make a nice soup, with
Steve Laughs
Aw.
All the food that’s encrusted in them.
That’s years of the homeless comin’ to the fore there.
Look at you,
But what I –
One step away from Laurence Llewellyn-Bowen.
I’d like to be, I’d like to be that bit closer.
Ricky Laughs.
But why are you dropping off the tickets.  Are you a little bit - ?  ‘Cause I thought, I thought you were married and stuff.  Why do you suddenly got this obsession with Gervais?
I’m a bit ‘a rough, in’t I!
Ricky and Steve chuckle
Yeah.  It’s like when you see Dale Winton out with those rough boys, I’d like to get one of me own!
When, when a top celebrity, in a lovely-looking suit drops - walks down a corridor with his penis out, I know I'm still attractive -
You know you've arrived!
Soit's I was inaugurated in the same way.  For me it was Des O'Connor.  It's like it's the passing of the baton if I may use that euphemism.
It’s fantastic, it is a pleasure. I still wake up and can’t believe it, I’m mates with Johnno.
Steve chuckles
Johnno.
Can I just point, I was listening to the show last week. I heard you, as always, revealing too much about yourself, if you don’t mind me saying so.
Not as much as you!
No, that was just for the benefit of the room.
Ricky and Steve laugh
When you used to talk about occasionally urinate in the sink.
Yeah.
When you were around my house last time.
Ricky and Steve laugh
And you looked a bit shifty. Nah, please reassure me.
It was more ownership. I marked my territory, and other people came in saying has Gervais been around here? It was just marking my territory.
Because my coffee in the morning has a hazelnut tang to it I don’t remember putting in.

Can I just say something, I used to mention to you Gervais when we first getting involved in business, if there was one celebrity I would like to be friends with was Jonathan Ross, lo behold Ricky befriended Jonathan Ross. I’m nowhere to be seen. Not invited around.
Ricky told me I could be his friend provided I never extended the arm of friendship.
Right I thought as much.
He tries to keep everyone else down he works with in the Office and from all the other shows. He tries to keep them down.
I wanted him to meet you on the steps. I didn’t even want to tell him you’re around. But you called and he said who’s that? And saw your name come up and said can I meet him?
You all are coming tonight aren’t ya?
This isn’t Radio 2 by the way, these links are way too long. This is snappy radio. We have to play a record.
The kids have lost interest.
The kids want to hear Coldplay, Catatonia, Faithless...
You know what I like is how about more of that instantly forgettable hip hop you play.
Get out.
Hip Hop Hooray? That’s the worst feature on British radio. You should be ashamed of yourselves.
Wait I’ve heard your quiz on Radio 2 you’re having a laugh.
Steve laughs
Put it away! Put it away!
I’m Karl.
Hi how you doing?
Alright. Got a question for you.
Yeah.
The Pope what semi-precious stone does the Pope wear?
That’s easy.
Go on.
Topaz.
Is that the right answer?
I don’t know I might have wrote it down wrong.
Steve laughs
I’m really sorry Jonathan.

That’s not what he publically admits to, but I have to know because I was hanging out with him at the Groucho one night. He said, have a look at this look at this. Look at that topaz. Go and buy that. Look at that. Vatican City.
Look at that, have a nice ring out of that.
Didn’t go anywhere, but thanks for asking.
Steve laughs
Gotta go. I got to buy some winkle pickers.
Thank you, thank you very much.
Karl, wish I could have said it was a pleasure, but it was quite creepy.
Ricky and Steve laugh
See ya later.
Eminem - The Real Slim Shady
U2 - Beautiful Day
U2 Beautiful Day.
Yep.
I was going to say that was one of my singles of the year, but was it this year or the year before.
Oh crumbs, I don’t know.
I think, was it 2000? Maybe that could be a question.
Steve laughs
No we need the answer.
We don’t know the answer. Can I just ask, Jonathan Ross just came in here to drop off some tickets for the comedy award show he’s hosting.
Yeah.
Later this evening. Interesting of course, for a man who is 40 and still finds it funny to get his penis out.
Ricky laughs
I love that. It’s like, when is that novelty going to wear off?
74, 75? When it’s just too horrible to show in public, I imagine.
But he drops off some tickets for you, was asking you fashion advice last night. I mean he came on after a 3 hour radio show on Radio 2. Good show by the way, worth tuning in.
Ricky laughs
Drop some tickets around now has to go rehearse the show. I was out with you last night went into this pub like we been to a few times before. This guy came in and said your usual table Ricky?
Ricky laughs
Your usual table? Can I just ask you two questions Godfather? One is, have we won a prize tonight? Two, can you have someone iced for me?
Ricky laughs
It’s ludicrous, what do you suddenly got over all these people? When did you suddenly become the daddy?
Well I came from nowhere, and y’know, I got Polaroid’s of all the head of all the stations. Yeah, exactly.

What I am worried about when we are wrapped up in our winter coats. You are going to have your little sort of black thing. I’m stood like your hood. Dya’know what I mean, like your goon.  That walks with you, twice as tall.
Ricky laughs
Very much like Edward G Robertson.
Exactly, you’re the one with the pug face, obviously.
Yeah, well, don’t go on about it, freak.
Alright no need.
We knock that. Even Jonathan Ross couldn’t save this show.
No.
He’s the only A-list celebrity I know. I’m all out of ideas. I thought we’d have a trivia game, that’s rubbish because he can’t read.
Or write.
Yeah.
So we knocking the trivia game all together?
Yeah.
Let’s have one final question.
What’s the answer. I don’t know.
The Pope one.
I don’t know.
We couldn’t even figure out the question Karl.
What’s the stone, what’s the stone?
Karl looking for the answer
Hold on a sec.
Just entertain yourself at home. While Karl looks for the answer.
Anthirst.
Amethyst.
Yep.
Anne Thirst? No she was the first woman MP I think you’ll find. Rubby & diamondo.
So do you have a final question?
It’s one all, one more question then we will knock it on the head.
Where-- what...
Ricky and Steve laugh
WHO...
Haven’t you been practicing, we had ads and we had music.
"Where, what."
Rick, I don’t think we should call ITV later.
Maybe he was talking about Jonathan’s inquiry on sartorial elegance. Wear what?
Yeah.
Maybe he just summed up that conversation in two-
What’s the most expensive pub in London? Ricky won’t know because he never pays.
Hang on a minute, what does that mean?
What does that mean, you want me to buy the pub? How much, that’s a million pounds sir.
You go in, according to the Time Out guide 2001 if you went in a bought a big round, it’s a dear pub.
Ricky laughs
It’s an expensive pub?
Imagine that on Millionaire. Imagine that question on Mastermind. Your specialized subject is how much things are an that and whether they make you fat when you eat then.
It’s in London.
Is this some guy went in a pub last night and going this is a bit pricey.
Ricky laughs
This is the most expensive pub I’ve been too.
I’m going to expose them on Ricky and Steve’s show.
Does he mean maybe is it a pub or a club maybe where got to be a member?
Nah, it’s a pub. I’ll narrow it down, it’s in Covent Garden.
Punch and Judy.
That’s it.
Has he got it right? Well I have to hand it to you well done.
Yep Brilliant.
So who was that question from, maybe they should get these three cds.
Let’s give them that.
Who is it Karl?
There is no way of verifying that, that’s probably libelous. They probably made-
It’s from Time Out guide.
Ok, alright.
What you moaning for, you got it right.
Yeah, I won, I won. Yeah, I won.
Karl who was it that won? Listen they know so they won.
Right.
This is genius radio. This is brilliant.
I’ll tell you what’s letting us down, him.
I know.
KP the P man.
Ricky laughs

When he was just here to press buttons he was cool, now we let him on the air because we thought he was funny and we quite like him, he’s digging a grave for us. Right this is a new feature I introduced called Songs I’d Like to Play on the Radio.
Ricky laughs
And uh, a friend of mine sent me a cd of little treats and stuff, one of them is this track called Monkey Man by the Rolling Stones, play it Karl. It’s an absolute gem.
the Rolling Stones - Monkey Man
XFM 104.9. What was that again, Steve?

Rolling Stones, and a track called Monkey Man. That's from a, er, double CD not available in the shops, my friend Dave G made a compilation for me, burned it onto CD, using modern technology. That's one of the tracks on there.
What's his name, what's his name?
Dave Greenwood, obviously breaking several copyright laws there.
Exactly
I would not encourage anyone to make copies of anything for anyone, it is against the law.
His name again, if the police are listening?
Dave Greenwood...lives in Nottingham...I can...
How dare he, how dare he!
...I can give details. It sickens me Rick.
He's making you receive, er
Stolen goods, and there's various artists on there who've barely got a penny, losing money hand over fist, the Rolling Stones for instance.
Yeah, and XFM have done that as well, played it off a, you know, and that's terrible, and now we've implicated those as well.
XFM are culpable...so is Dave G...Thankfully not us, Rick.
No.
We're just middle men, caught up in it.
You know what I mean? Mr. Biggs behind it.
There's always a Mr. Biggs.
And we're just the pawns in his game!
And, er, I'll be playing another track from that later on.
I've got a lovely couple of little tracks, from my hip-hop selection.
Looking forward to it.
And...
Incidentally, Rick, can I just ask, did you get a little gift here from XFM?
I did, um, I got a lovely little voucher here, um, it was very nice.
Yeah, very thoughtful, I've also got one, how much is yours for?
To spend at John Lewis' or Waitrose.
Yeah.
